availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Manuel Garcia (Mercer County, KY, tailor and soldier (CSA))

body.p: Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, tailor and soldier. Native of Oaxaca, Mexico. Married Sarah Selch Garcia in Mercer County, Kentucky in March 1861. Father of George Thomas Garcia, Sarah Garcia, and Elizabeth Garcia. Veteran of the U.S. - Mexico War. Captured by the American army at the Battle of Chapultepec in 1847. Immigrated to Kentucky c1848. Tailor in Harrodsburg in 1860. Served in Byrne's Battery under John Hunt Morgan (C.S.A.) as an artillerist until 1863.
